args.natural_language_statement: Let G ⊆ Mat_{n×n}(ℝ) be a nonempty set closed under products and inverses (i.e., a matrix group). Prove that the identity matrix I belongs to G. Translate to Lean4 (no proof), statement must end with := by sorry.

retrieved_examples.nl: If H is a nonempty subgroup of a group G, then the identity element of G belongs to H.
retrieved_examples.lean:
variable {G : Type*} [Group G] {H : Set G} (Hsub : IsSubgroup H) (hne : H.Nonempty)

theorem subgroup_nonempty_contains_one : (1 : G) ∈ H := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: Let S be a nonempty set of real numbers closed under addition and additive inverses; then 0 ∈ S.
retrieved_examples.lean:
variable {S : Set ℝ} (hclosed : ∀ x y, x ∈ S → y ∈ S → x + y ∈ S) (hinv : ∀ x, x ∈ S → -x ∈ S) (hne : S.Nonempty)

theorem additive_subgroup_nonempty_contains_zero : (0 : ℝ) ∈ S := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: If G is a nonempty subset of GL(n, R) closed under multiplication and inverses then I_n ∈ G.
retrieved_examples.lean:
variable {n : ℕ} {G : Set (Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ)} (hclosed : ∀ A B, A ∈ G → B ∈ G → A ⬝ B ∈ G) (hinv : ∀ A, A ∈ G → A⁻¹ ∈ G) (hne : G.Nonempty)

theorem matrix_group_nonempty_contains_identity : (1 : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ) ∈ G := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib


/-- Let G ⊆ Mat_{n×n}(ℝ) be a nonempty set closed under products and inverses (i.e., a matrix group). Prove that the identity matrix I belongs to G. Translate to Lean4 (no proof), statement must end with := by sorry. -/
theorem matrix_group_nonempty_contains_identity {n : ℕ} {G : Set (Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ)} (hclosed : ∀ A B, A ∈ G → B ∈ G → A * B ∈ G) (hinv : ∀ A, A ∈ G → A⁻¹ ∈ G) (hne : G.Nonempty) : (1 : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ) ∈ G := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let G ⊆ Mat_{n×n}(ℝ) be a nonempty set closed under products and inverses (i.e., a matrix group). Prove that the identity matrix I belongs to G. -/
theorem matrix_group_nonempty_contains_identity {n : ℕ} {G : Set (Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ)}
  (hclosed : ∀ A B, A ∈ G → B ∈ G → A ⬝ B ∈ G)
  (hinv : ∀ A, A ∈ G → ∃ B, B ∈ G ∧ A ⬝ B = 1 ∧ B ⬝ A = 1)
  (hne : G.Nonempty) : (1 : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ) ∈ G := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let G ⊆ Mat_{n×n}(ℝ) be a nonempty set closed under products and inverses (i.e., a matrix group). -/
theorem matrix_group_nonempty_contains_identity {n : ℕ} {G : Set (Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ)}
  (hclosed : ∀ A B, A ∈ G → B ∈ G → A ⬝ B ∈ G)
  (hinv : ∀ A, A ∈ G → ∃ B, B ∈ G ∧ A ⬝ B = 1 ∧ B ⬝ A = 1)
  (hne : ∃ X, X ∈ G) : (1 : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ) ∈ G := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let G ⊆ Mat_{n×n}(ℝ) be a nonempty set closed under products and inverses (i.e., a matrix group). -/
theorem matrix_group_nonempty_contains_identity {n : ℕ} {G : Set (Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ)}
  (hclosed : ∀ A B, A ∈ G → B ∈ G → A ⬝ B ∈ G)
  (hinv : ∀ A, A ∈ G → ∃ B, B ∈ G ∧ A ⬝ B = 1 ∧ B ⬝ A = 1)
  (hne : G.Nonempty) : (1 : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ) ∈ G := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Let G ⊆ Mat_{n×n}(Real) be a nonempty set closed under products and inverses (i.e., a matrix group). -/
theorem matrix_group_nonempty_contains_identity {n : ℕ} {G : Set (Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) Real)}
  (hclosed : ∀ A B, A ∈ G → B ∈ G → A * B ∈ G)
  (hinv : ∀ A, A ∈ G → Exists fun b => b ∈ G ∧ A * b = 1 ∧ b * A = 1)
  (hne : Exists fun x => x ∈ G) : (1 : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) Real) ∈ G := by sorry
